12 Principles of Green Chemistry

üõ°Ô∏èPrevention

It is better to prevent waste than to treat or clean up waste after it is formed.

‚öõÔ∏èAtom Economy

Synthetic methods should be designed to maximize the incorporation of all materials used in the process.

‚ö†Ô∏èLess Hazardous Synthesis

Synthetic methods should be designed to use and generate substances with little or no toxicity.

üíßSafer Solvents

Auxiliary substances should be made unnecessary wherever possible and innocuous when used.

‚ö°Energy Efficiency

Energy requirements should be recognized and minimized.

üå±Renewable Feedstocks

A raw material or feedstock should be renewable rather than depleting.

üîÑReduce Derivatives

Unnecessary derivatization should be minimized or avoided.

üß≤Catalysis

Catalytic reagents are superior to stoichiometric reagents.
